author: DarwinJS
body:
The usefulness of PowerShell's help system could be dramatically improved if conceptual help (about_*) topics supported the same format in the files and the same filtering using get-help available for comment based help.

It is evident by existing about_* help files that many help authors follow the basic format of comment based help - so it stands to reason there would be value in limiting the output to these sections.


For instance, many a conceptual help files contain examples, but the following command is not possible:

````Get-Help about_sometopic -examples````

In addition, conceptual help has the greatest risk to getting very long and unwieldy to read. This argues for value of:
- being able to limit output with things like "-examples"
- being able to add "role" or "component" info to show related help topics across multiple **related** about_* help files

````Get-Help about_somedocs* -component abc````

The seeming unused or low use get-help "category" items of "FAQ"

On Windows PowerShell Get-help get-help -parameter category lists only these value values: Alias, Cmdlet, Function, Provider, Workflow, and HelpFile

On PowerShell 6 there are some nice new categories that seem unimplemented. (````get-help * | select -unique category````).

Some of these seem like they would be useful when applied to about_* help files - specifically: "General", "FAQ" and "Glossary"

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body:
Opps I should have restarted pwsh 6.  I was able to get .SYNOPSIS to show up after adding it to an existing about_PSReadLine file.

Seems like .SYNOPSIS in contextual help might work in PowerShell 6, but not 5.x.

None of the other items seem to work - like specifying Component or Role and then using -component or -role to select.

title: about_* help files should support same format and filtering as comment based help
